meanings.definition: To divide a word into syllables.
meanings.sent1: She will syllabicate the long word for her friend.
meanings.sent2: It is important to syllabicate words when learning to read.
meanings.sent3: The teacher tried to syllabicate 'elephant' but kept getting it wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her voice syllabicated the room, filling it with sound.
meanings.sent5: As she syllabicated the word, each part became clearer to her.

meanings.definition: To pronounce or divide into syllables.
meanings.sent1: He will syllabicate the poem for the class.
meanings.sent2: When you syllabicate a word, it helps with pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to syllabicate the new word its owner taught it.
meanings.sent4: His speech syllabicated the air, making everyone listen.
meanings.sent5: She carefully syllabicated each syllable, making sure to enunciate clearly.
